fields.description:
Attachment dialog gets shown in wrong lanuage.

This has been logged as:
https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-18086


Essentially my jira installation is english and keyboard mapping is danish. The dialog is shown in a wrong language.
fields.summary: Attachment dialog gets shown in wrong language

fields.description:
the first link, used in the left panel, eg for assignee or reporter works just fine:
http://jira.xxx.net/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=testuser

this one, generated from [~username] doesn´t work:
http://jira.xxx.net/jira/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?username=testuser

can this be fixed or how can i fix this on my own?
fields.summary: [~username] points always to own profile

fields.description: When the user uploaded the file *docx and *.xlsx extensions, the icon will be converted as {{file.gif}} instead of {{word.gif}} and {{excel.gif}}.
fields.summary: Unrecognised icon for file extension (*.docx) and (*.xlsx)

fields.description: A malformed URL allows an XSS attack on the 500 page.
fields.summary: XSS on CreateIssue post

fields.description:
I'm an active user on Linden Lab's public implementation of jira: https://jira.secondlife.com/secure/Dashboard.jspa

We have a high volume of inexperienced users filing issues, often with little or no searching beforehand. And as a result, a high volume of duplicate issues. It gets rather tedious having to click resolve, resolve the issue as a duplicate, then click link, and input the issue key. The slowness of LL's jia server doesn't help matters, but that's beside the point

It would greatly increase efficiency if we could link and resolve an issue on the same page. Particularly for duplicates. It also seems rather illogical to be able to resolve an issue as duplicate without specifying what it's a duplicate of in the first place.
fields.summary: Link & Resolve at the same time

fields.description: User is running JIRA Services under 64 bit Windows 2003 servers. JIRA creates log files at {{C:\WINDOWS\SysWOW64}}, however, in _Administration-> System->Support Request->Attach JIRA logs, it indicates that the log files is located at {{C:\WINDOWS\system32\atlassian-jira.log}}.
fields.summary: Log file path which shown at the Support Request Page is incorrect
Strikethrough incorrectly "-" matches values within  and out from the noformat macro

fields.description:
As a JIRA user, very often I need to change say the priority or status of a set of issues in my task list.  Right now I have to open each issue, then click edit, then Update then get back to the list.  This is a lot of steps for something that the user has to do often.  I am aware of the Bulk Edit feature, but this only works if the edits you are planning to make are the same for the whole set of issues.  So if you are changing the status on one and the priority on another two, you can't use this feature.

Thanks
fields.summary: Ability to edit attributes of an issue in a table view

fields.description:
We run JIRA in private mode - we create accounts for our customers.
Logon page is saying to contact admins to request account, there is no "Sign up for account" link,
but "signup" link can be seen on Login Required page, see screenshot.
fields.summary: Incorrect text on "Login Required" page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-14096].
  {panel}

Using the wiki markup for superscript and subscript don't work inside a word (unless you know the wiki "noformat" workaround)

This error is also reported in Confluence: http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-6007

Test:

m^3^ - m{^}3{^}.
CO~2~ - CO{~}2{~}.
fields.summary: Text formatting with wiki markup fails

fields.description:
In this doc:
* http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/bugzilla_import.html

We may want to mention to have the importers run a Sanity Check before doing the import, because it probably can't hurt, and it looks like (due to [this support case|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-17874]) it can help.
fields.summary: Modify Importing from Bugzilla docs to mention running a Sanity Check in Bugzilla before doing the import

fields.description:
It appears that the language translation for the months of the calendar are not changing according to the user's language settings in their Profile.

To recreate the issue:

# Set the OS environment LANG to something like German: "export LANG=de_DE" (Or you can set JIRA's Default Language to something like Russian.)
# Start JIRA
# Verify Calendar months appear in German when using the Date Picker.
# Login with another user and specify in their Profile the language to English (US).  The site should show English when the user logs in.  However, when creating an issue and using the date picker, the months shown are still in German.
fields.summary: Calendar popup language doesn't change according to user's configured Profile

fields.description:
Relates to JRA-9699 but is not the same. When referencing an image like \!myimage.jpg\! in wiki markup in description or comment or whatever, this appears as a broken link in the email that is sent. Base URL is correctly set in config, and site added to safe senders in outlook. Unlike JRA-9699, I don't see how this could ever work. Whereas all icons and stylesheets have the full URL, the image is rendered as: There's no base href in the email so this will not work. It does work if one uses the full URL in the wiki text. Currently I'm thinking about adding a tag in the email/html/includes/header.vm file, hopefully there is a an available velocity variable corresponding to the base URL. h4. Workaround for JIRA 5.2.11: # Add the following source code in {{issuementioned.vm}} like here: {code} #disable_html_escaping() #parse("templates/email/html/includes/header.vm") #set ($authorLink = "#authorlink2($remoteUser.name $linkstyle)") #set ($issueType = $issue.getIssueTypeObject()) #set ($issueLink = "#renderIcon(${issueType.iconUrlHtml} ${issueType.getNameTranslation($i18n)}) $issue.getKey()") #emailbanner($remoteUser "jira.mentions.email.header" $authorLink $issueLink '') #if ($comment)
#parse("templates/email/html/includes/fields/comment.vm") #parse("templates/email/html/includes/mention-actions.vm")
#end #parse("templates/email/html/includes/footer.vm") {code} # Restart JIRA. (i) To find the Email Velocity files, please read [Customizing Email Content|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Customizing+Email+Content] article.
fields.summary: images that are referenced in wikitext are broken in emails

fields.description:
After a JIRA instance has been setup, you can still access the first Setup page by manually browsing to the URL.

Attempting to advance beyond this screen or import data correctly results in the "Already Setup" page being displayed. However, the default language for the instance can be modified without any security checks.
fields.summary: Setup page is accessable after JIRA instance has been setup already

fields.description:
Currently the SearchRequest entity  is defined like this :

{noformat}
 <entity entity-name="SearchRequest" table-name="searchrequest" package-name="">
       ...
        <field name="request" col-name="reqcontent" type="very-long"/>

    </entity>
{noformat}

On Oracle 10g this is defined as varchar(4000).  This means that search requests cant be bigger than that.

It could be this :

{noformat}
 <entity entity-name="SearchRequest" table-name="searchrequest" package-name="">
       ...
        <field name="request" col-name="reqcontent" type="extremely-long"/>

    </entity>
{noformat}


We had a customer who migrated from MYSQL (very-long ~ 32K) to ORACLE 10G and had problems because they had search requests > 4K

We should up the limit for Oracle 10g in the next release of JIRA.

We may want to consider other enities that use 'very-long' when we do this.
fields.summary: SearchRequest entity should use a extemely-long field types on Oracle 10g

fields.description:
The gzip work that went into 3.11 seems to be causing some problems.
Our config at the moment is:

{noformat}Firefox -> ssl -> apache (keepalives enabled)-> mod-jk -> tomcat -> jira - gzip enabled -> crowd{noformat}

Quite a complex setup, but one that should be fully supported.

When a file is first downloaded, it works fine.  If you try download same file again it can hang.  Clicking on thumbnails also causes some problems when displaying the large image.

Opera seems to work ok.

This may be related to the problems we were seeing on the similar setup with resin. (css not down loading).
fields.summary: gzip/tomcat/apache/keepalives/ssl is not playing nicely with file downloads

fields.description: When you have a select list which is optional, there is no way to search for issues that do not have a value defined. This is particularly annoying when you are trying to assign a value to them and you cannot filter them.
fields.summary: No way to search by empty values in select list (none)

fields.description: There are several examples in this very JIRA instance. There is an "overflow" property in CSS that would make the usability of JIRA better when there is a wide unformatted data line in the issue history.
fields.summary: When a JIRA user opens an issue or adds a comment with really wide data, the UI becomes virtually unreadable

fields.description: I would find it helpful to be able to "Create a related issue" while viewing an existing issue.  This feature would launch the interface to log a new issue but include the ability to specify a related issue link to the issue I was just viewing.
fields.summary: Option to create a related issue
DoubleConverter /  NumberCFType is not as I18N as it could / should be - decimal separator does not respect user's locale

fields.description:
Subscription e-mails once contained description(s) of the search conditions used to generate it. The e-mail templates used to call SearchRequestUtils.getDescription for each search condition and add the result to the email. However, SearchRequestUtils.getDescription was removed in SVN:12412 and this no longer works. Consequently, blank space was left where the description should have been.

I have removed all code references to SearchRequestUtils.getDescription from the e-mail templates for the time being (since no one actually noticed). 

We need to work out if this was actually meant to occur and if not fix it.
fields.summary: No description in e-mail of subscription filter conditions.

fields.description: Viewing subscriptions under standard does not render correctly. Check the attached image for details.
fields.summary: Viewing subscriptions under standard does not render correctly.

fields.description: See attachment showing a very slight mistake in the warning message.
fields.summary: {0}all{1} in warning for Issue Type Schemes

fields.description:
I added the following info into a Confluence issue on CPU usage. We have very high CPU usage and database logical IO, and suspect that this may be the cause. They asked us to post this to JIRA, so here it is.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>

Please take a look at the spreadsheet I just attached (20071129 Parameterized Queries.xls). That shows summary information for all the parameterized queries that ran last night. For each distinct query, it shows how many times it ran, and how much system recourses it took over the night. This was for the time period 5:30 PM last night (Nov 28) to 7:00 AM this morning (Nov 29). 

The top two queries jump out at me big time.
- The first one ran over 5,000 times, taking almost 2.25 hours total time to run these queries. 
- The second one ran almost 4.5 MILLION times. Amazing. The query is actually pretty small, and has a cumulative time of only 5 or 6 minutes. 

Regarding the first query, our DBA says it is not optimized for performance. It only has one join condition, but multiple OR conditions in the WHERE clause. These OR conditions are killing performance. The DBA says it would be much better to have several queries with simple WHERE clauses (which will use the indexes properly) with a UNION to combine the results. Is there a way this query can be optimized?

Regarding the second query, even though it's REALLY fast (taking only a few minutes total over the night even though it ran so many times), executing ANYTHING 4.5 million times seems to be a very possible candidate for our CPU problem. Do you know what this query is, and why it's running so many times?

Questions -
1 - Can we modfiy the SQL of that first query somehow in the code?
2 - Why is that other query running so many times? What is it? Is this our CPU problem?

I think the DBA is suggesting that the SQL be modified to the following:

SELECT columns...
FROM tables...
WHERE children0_.PARENTID= Parameter_1
UNION
SELECT columns...
FROM tables...
WHERE children0_.PARENTID= Parameter_2
UNION
SELECT columns...
FROM tables...
WHERE children0_.PARENTID= Parameter_3

Of course, the followup question is, why are these queries getting fired at all, and why so many times?

Eric
fields.summary: Confluence query is not optimized well

fields.description:
We want to configure JIRA to show different content on Logon screen and on Default Dashboard for registered users.
For example,  Introduction portlet should be shown on Logon, but not needed at all for users on their dashboard - it wastes a lot of screen space and useless for users who are not new in JIRA.
fields.summary: Allow to specify a different dashboard for non-looged in users to logged in users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-14067].
  {panel}

I just had a support customer who could not work out from our documentation how to increase perm gen space on Linux. We have had a few similar cases recently.

This is the page: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Increasing+JIRA+memory.

We need specific instructions on what exactly to do for perm gen. The current page is not specific enough. It assumes you have read through everything above and can then adapt what you have learnt for setting perm gen, which is asking a lot of customers. Also, if for example you are on Linux, most of the above doco you wade through is not relevant.

I think it could use a bit of a restructure and then more specific instructions.

Also it doesn't currently say where in setenv.sh or setenv.bat to add the line. It needs to.
fields.summary: Improve "Increasing JIRA Memory" page
support S/MIME for email communication in JIRA

fields.description:
If your dashboard is in configure mode and you have multiple dashboard pages defined, open a different dashboard page in a second browser window/tab (but same browser) and then in the original browser window click one of the portlet move icons (e.g. move up, move down). The page crashes.

This is because the current dashboard page is stored in the session and the portlet move operation gets the portal page from that session.
fields.summary: Configuring two dashboard pages in different browser tabs leads to page crash

fields.description:
Currently, users wanting to import content from other issue trackers than Bugzilla, Mantis or FogBugz are informed that they should use the CSV importer. However, there are at least a few third-party script available seem to be much better choices than the CSV importer. Specifically, the Trac importer mentioned at http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-13688 may be much better option for Trac importers than CSV importing. There may be more unofficial import scripts available for other tools as well so it would be useful to research these. 

If we can make it clear that these are unsupported since they are third-party tools and point users to the forums for assistance, we could link to these in the CSV import page at http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/csv_import.html although the actual list would possibly be better off being maintained under the JIRA extensions or community space.
fields.summary: Link to and/or document third-party issue importers on CSV import page

fields.description:
Custom dashboards created by users should be allowed to be sharable.
Many times Managers create dashboards to report on specific projects, etc.  They would like to share this work with other managers, developers, etc.
By sharing a complete dashboard would allow other users to qucikly get up to speed working on projects.
Enhancement should include,
Sharing Dashboard.
User should be able to copy a shared dashboard so they can customize their own version of it.
fields.summary: Dashboards should be sharable

fields.description:
When typing a name in the "Single user" portion of the "Add new permission" section of the admin browser, the page shifts upwards preventing the user from using the interface

Reproduction:
# Open the Add New Permission Section
# Put a dot in the Single User option
# Start typing a name (ensure that your database has enough names in it such that the ajax user picker becomes quite large when it queries) our jira instance has 400+ users)
# observe that the page will shift upwards
# click away from the ajax picker - do not pick a user
# observe that the page is now unusable.

Note:

My Display size is 1920x1200 and my JIRA Logo Banner is of size: 529pxx64px
fields.summary: Using the AJAX User Picker within the "Add New Permission" section of the admin panel causes the page to become unusable

fields.description:
I just lost my previously half-reported bug because JIRA's cache headers break browser navigation.

Please fix a la Oysta's post on Extranet:

http://extranet.atlassian.com/display/DEV/HTTP+caching+primer

I'll now go ahead and raise the first bug again. :P
fields.summary: Caching headers prevent browser back button working
MappedSortComparator needs to reduce its memory footprint
Notification scheme can set "Previous Assignee" and "Current Assignee"

fields.description:
The 'Importing users from LDAP' page at http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Importing+user+from+LDAP may be confusing because it does not reference the LDAP integration alternative or when to use each option. There should be an overview added that indicates in which circumstances it is preferable to migrate users rather than add live integration, with a link to http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/ldap.html

Also, if there are LDAP configurations that are only supported by migration option, these should be linked on that LDAP integration page at http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/ldap.html
fields.summary: Add overview to 'Importing users from LDAP' that refers to alternative LDAP integration

fields.description: I use the 'Σ Remaining Estimate' in your issue navigator instead of the default 'Remaining Estimate' so I have an idea of the estimates in tasks and subtasks. However, you can not sort on that column. I want to sort to be able to see the issues that have no estimates on them or a remaining estimate of 0 minutes (since you cannot define a search filter for this, unless I overlooked something).
fields.summary: Issue navigator should be able to sort on 'Σ Remaining Estimate' column

fields.description: It would be helpful to allow users to share a Filter with a specific user or users. We have a confluence integration account in order to display shared filters in Confluence without people exposing their personal passwords. Right now they have to share will all users in order for the confluence user to have access to the filter. If we could share just with the confluence user then it would make the interface cleaner for filters that don't apply to everyone.
fields.summary: Allow Sharing A Filter With Specific User(s)

fields.description:
Usage scenario:
# User reads comment
# User marks comment as read by hiding it
# We store hidden state in cookie
# Once 4K limit is reached, comments that were hidden suddenly become visible

One part of the problem is that the way we store this information in the cookie is VERY inefficient - 
{noformat}
|comment-36381-closed=1|comment-36381-open=0|
{noformat}
I haven't looked into it, but there is a lot of duplication there - {{comment}}, {{closed}}, {{open}}. and even {{1, -, 0}}.  We also store state for opened as well as closed.  Isn't this binary?  i.e. if it isn't one, it must be the other?

If we were smart, we could store twice as much in there.

The alternative, is to move this state to the server.  I am imagining an ajaxy solution...
fields.summary: Hidding lots of comments fills up cookie / hits limit

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-14039].
  {panel}

For workflow transitions, you can set Conditions, Validators and POST functions.
Only, what I miss as Conditions is the value of a certain field, such as Resolution.  I want to show a certain transition  (Pre-approve resolution) if the Resolution is Fix, but don't want to show it when it is e.g. User workaround.
Now I can only define user or subtask conditions.

For POST functions it is already possible to set a value for Resolution, which is very useful.
Can't it easily be done for Condition, too?
fields.summary: Ability to set field values as condition for workflow transition

fields.description:
The Project Statistics portlet has an option for Show Resolved Issues... but enabling this option also shows Closed issues.  Over the lifetime of a project, the number of Closed issues increases to the point that the percentages become nearly meaningless (or even nonexistent) for other issue states.

Would like the ability to see Resolved issues in the Project Statistics portlet without also seeing Closed.
fields.summary: Distinguish between Resolved and Closed for Project Statistics portlet option

fields.description:
If there is a slow network connection between web browser and the box running JIRA, and if the JIRA instance has many projects (of the order of 100 or more), and if the user has the Projects Portlet on their dashboard, then the dashboard does not display in Internet Explorer 6 and 7. It works fine in Firefox.

The browser (Internet Explorer) renders the header - the logo and the Home | Browse Projects | Find Issues | Create New Issue, but then not the rest of the dashboard page.

The browser appears to try to reload the page a few times. This is apparent because the page briefly flashes and the "Waiting for <URL>" text at the bottom of the browser seems to redisplay. Sometimes there is first a "Website found. Waiting for reply." message briefly displayed in the message window at the bottom of the browser. The browser tries this several times, sometimes for 30 seconds or so, sometimes for several minutes, before finally giving up, displaying a popup window saying:

    Internet Explorer cannot open the Internet site <URL>.
    Operation aborted.

This behaviour is readily reproducible using a local import of http://developer.atlassian.com/jira and using [TCPMon|http://ws.apache.org/commons/tcpmon/] to simulate a slow network connection. Use the following delay settings in TCPMon:

    Bytes per pause: 1024
    Delay in Milliseconds: 50

The behaviour is also readily observable on http://developer.atlassian.com/jira (if you add the Projects Portlet to your dashboard, or create a new dashboard page containing the Projects Portlet). The problem was previously reported by two (separate) support customers. In their cases it only appears on slow links. 

The behaviour is not observable on the local import of http://developer.atlassian.com/jira if you do not use the delay.

It is interesting to note that at the times when the browser seems to be trying to reload the page, the shell running TCPMon displays the following error:
{noformat}
java.net.SocketException: Broken pipe
        at java.net.SocketOutputStream.socketWrite0(Native Method)
        at java.net.SocketOutputStream.socketWrite(SocketOutputStream.java:92)
        at java.net.SocketOutputStream.write(SocketOutputStream.java:136)
        at org.apache.ws.commons.tcpmon.SocketRR.run(SocketRR.java:213)
{noformat}

Microsoft has a bug report for the above error message: http://support.microsoft.com/default.aspx/kb/927917. However that bug relates to Javascript, specifically to when a child container HTML element contains script code that tries to modify the parent container element of the child container. It is unlikely that this bug is the cause of our error, as you can turn off Javascript in IE and comment out all Javascript and links to Javascript files in the served page, and the error still occurs.

We tried saving the static page back on the server (do a View Source in Firefox after the page is successfully displayed, then save it back to the server), and then accessing it.  Same error occurs.

We tried another page that is about the same size - ~900K - and it displays correctly. So the error is content specific. Perhaps it is related to nested tables?

We spent significant time trying to find the root cause and have been unable to. As there are straightforward workarounds, we will not spend any more time on it at this stage.

The workarounds are either:
- Don't use the Projects Portlet in the dashboard if you have lots of projects. If you want links to projects on your dashboard, consider using the Project Table portlet instead.
- Use Firefox instead of Internet Explorer.
fields.summary: Dashboard containing Projects Portlet does not display in Internet Explorer if many (100+) projects and over slow network

fields.description:
If you add security level as a field to Workflow transitions, then the user is able to change the security level field when transitioning an issue.
For subtasks, you should not be able to set this value explicitly, as the subtask should always take on the security level of its parent.

For a subtask workflow transition, the user is presented with an editable drop down for the security level.
The rest of the code correctly ignores this new value and leaves the parent's security level, but it would be better to 
not show the drop down at all.
eg show a read-only message.
See for instance the behaviour in v4.0 when you try to Bulk Edit a subtask only.
fields.summary: When security level appears as a field on Workflow transitions, then it should not be editable for subtasks.

fields.description:
In the latest version of the docs, I noticed a warning message on the [CVS integration page|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.11/cvs_integration.html#modules]:

bq. *Warning* - JIRA has a [bug|JRA-10531] where a restart is required after editing a CVS module.

This bug appears to have been fixed in 3.10, so I'm guessing the docs cleanup was just forgotten about by mistake.
fields.summary: Remove warning from docs page

fields.description:
Hi 
There is a "sub-task blocking condition" which guarantees  the parent task can not be closed while subtasks are opened, so when main task is closed no subtask remains opened.
However, any user can create a subtask in a closed tasks, which leads to the same situation; main task is closed but subtasks remain opened; which makes subtask management much more complicated; parent issue should be reopened before allowing subtask to be created within.
fields.summary: Subtask can be created when parent issue is closed

fields.description:
I composed a somewhat lengthy, detailed message about Fisheye performance issues, including solutions.

Then a stray touch on my touch pad led to Firefox navigating to the previous screen, when I was about to find the Create button!

Attempting to return forward to the message I was entering failed, because Firefox informed me that the page was the result of a POST, and did I want to resubmit?

Well, resubmitting causes the previous form content to go away! And not resubmitting doesn't get you back to it, either.

When a POST takes you to a form, it should do so by first doing a redirect to a GET that serves up the form. Otherwise, you'll get exactly what I got!

It seems like an extraneous round-trip with the browser, but it's really not. It's important for usability.
fields.summary: Form data lost when using back and forward web browser buttons

fields.description: When viewing the time tracking report in Internet Explorer 7 and clikcing on the "Excel View" link you are presented with an error message from IE that it cannot download the file. There is no issue from Firefox on both Mac and Windows or Safari.
fields.summary: Time Tracking Report Excel view will not open in Internet Explorer 7

fields.description:
Why to show sub-task icon in the list of sub-tasks if they are are sub-tasks?
See screenshot.
Better to replace it to priority icon to see sub-tasks priorities.
fields.summary: Useless Sub-task icon in the list of sub-tasks

fields.description:
When Creating a new issue, if something is wrong with issue fields typed in (e.g. a required field is left blank, or an invalid value is entered), JIRA returns the user back to Create Issue screen and highlights the erroneous fields with pink. That's cool :) - BUT:

All the fields which had their values entered retain their values, *except Attachment fields*. This is not crucial but requires browsing through the filesystem again, and it's not consistent with other fields behaviour.

Steps to reproduce (same on Opera and IE):

1. Go to "Create new issue"
2. Select a Project
3. On `Step 2 of 2: Enter the details of the issue...' leave some required fields empty, fill some fields, add couple of attachments and click Create 

EXPECTED: all filled fields hold entered values, including attachments. fields with missing data are highlighted
OBSERVED: all filled fields hold entered values, except attachments. fields with missing data are highlighted
fields.summary: UI "forgets" the Attachment field if issue created incorrectly

fields.description: There is a inconsistency on the attach file page, see attached screenshot
fields.summary: Wrong language on file attach screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-14024].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce the problem:
# Create a new CVS module
#- set the timeout to *60000* seconds
#- (other fields have to be valid in order to test the CVS module)
# In the CVS modules screen, click Test

You will receive the following exception:
{noformat}
Error occurred while obtaining cvs or parsing the cvs log.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
	at edu.emory.mathcs.backport.java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.waitFor(FutureTask.java:277)
	at edu.emory.mathcs.backport.java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.get(FutureTask.java:127)
	at com.atlassian.jira.vcs.cvsimpl.CvsRepositoryUtilImpl.updateCvs(CvsRepositoryUtilImpl.java:336)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.vcs.RepositoryActionSupport.testRepository(RepositoryActionSupport.java:288)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.vcs.RepositoryTest.doExecute(RepositoryTest.java:68)
{noformat}
fields.summary: Testing CVS module throws IllegalArgumentException

fields.description:
On the View User page, user properties that contain URLs should be rendered as a hyperlinks so that viewers can click straight through. The workaround is to copy and paste the URL.

This is valuable for associating JIRA users with objects in external systems, such as support users who want to associate a company profile with a user.
fields.summary: URLs embedded in user properties should be hyperlinked

fields.description:
Hi Andrew,

I have some minor fixes to the JIRA Tomcat 6 doco.

In the *Modify Tomcat server.xml* section, the two XML excerpts are different. They should be:

Before:

{code}
<Connector port="8080" protocol="HTTP/1.1" 
               connectionTimeout="20000" 
               redirectPort="8443"/>
 {code}

And I have a few other changes that I will give you marked-up hardcopy for.

It would be great if these changes could be in the 3.12 doco.

Thanks.

Kind regards,
Ian

and after:

{code}
<Connector port="8080" protocol="HTTP/1.1" 
               connectionTimeout="20000" 
               redirectPort="8443" useBodyEncodingForURI="true"/>
 {code}
fields.summary: JIRA Tomcat 6.0 doco changes

fields.description:
JIRA internationalizes the keys in the System Info page. This is fine.

However it also internationalises the strings when submitting automatic support requests by email. This means we get text like:

{noformat}
Environment Information:

    Sistem Kodlama: utf-8
    Java Satıcısı: Sun Microsystems Inc.
    JVM Versiyon: 1.0
    Kullanıcı Adı: serdarsultanoglu
    Vertabanı URLi: Gizli
    Sistem Tarihi: Wednesday, 21 Nov 2007
    Java VM: Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM 
{noformat}

This makes it impossible to reliably process this environment information, eg. to extract things to custom fields, so we can generate statistics.
fields.summary: Don't internationalize text in automated support request emails

fields.description:
I am currently using a trial of JIRA Professional.

I have created a user that is in the Jira-Users group only. I have also create 3 dashboard pages for the user. One default dashbord page and other two pages are specific to certain projects.

However when i try to add any portlets to the third page they do not appear on the thrid page. Rather they are always added to the first page which. This is not the case with the second page. 

So far the only workaround i have found is if i move the page i want to setup to first position then add all the portlets i want then move it back to third position. I was also getting NPE in the apache persistance layer you use when trying to delete some portlets on a page. Unfortunately i don't have the stack trace but will add to this bug if it happens again.
fields.summary: Adding a portlet to a dashboard page always adds to the first page

fields.description:
We use User Properties to add Contact info for our customers - Company, Title, Phone, etc.
Our Project Administrators are not members of jira-administrators group.
They cannot see these custom properties (see screenshot, red rectangle).
All other information (name, full name, email, groups)of customer they can see.
fields.summary: Project Administrators cannot see user's custom properties

fields.description:
Hi,

I have recently upgraded from Jira 3.6.2 to 3.11 Enterprise edition (Standalone).

A new DB was created with appropriate user permissions etc.
I backed up the the issues (XML).
I backed up Custom plugins and JTDS.
Edited server.xml and entityengine.xml.

I have the instance of JIRA working fine except when a user tries to create an issue in one particular project, and enters data in one custom field we get:


Errors

    * org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericEntityException: while inserting: [GenericEntity:CustomFieldValue][id,16668][datevalue,2007-11-14 00:00:00.0][issue,12298][parentkey,null][customfield,10002] (SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO customfieldvalue (ID, ISSUE, CUSTOMFIELD, PARENTKEY, STRINGVALUE, NUMBERVALUE, TEXTVALUE, DATEVALUE, VALUETYPE) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?) (Violation of PRIMARY KEY constraint 'PK_customfieldvalue'. Cannot insert duplicate key in object 'customfieldvalue'.))



Attached is my log file.

Thanks,

Seán
fields.summary: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericEntityException

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-14015].
  {panel}

Since the 3.11, Time-tracking data can includes the issue's sub-tasks. This is a great long time expected feature. And I think we can make it even better.

Let's consider the following (I guess realistic in the way people uses Jira) scenario:

Most of the initial high level estimates are made on the Parent issue. 
Then as the issue understanding increases, estimated subtasks are created.

In order to keep the total estimated effort coherent between the Parent and its Children, the owner of a subtask must update the Parent according to the time tracking information passed in the children. For instance, if I initially estimate a Parent issue to 5 days of effort, if I then split it in 5 subtasks of 1 day, I can decide to reduce the remaining of the Parent issue in similar proportion (otherwise I'll get 10 days in the consolidated view). 

This should be an option - maybe I'll be pleased to keep a effort margin at the parent level "in case of".

Currently, this little process, while understood by our users, is quite cumbersome: update subtasks timetracking, than udpate parent timetracking.
It has a direct impact of the reliability of the information gathered at parent level.

We would like a shortcut in the subtask worklog screen that would allow the users to update the parent timetracking according to the children changes.
Sounds like a small change, but we do think it would increase the reliability of the time tracking data.
fields.summary: Add a "AutoAdjust Issue and Parent" option in the Worklog screen for subtasks

fields.description:
In a portlet (two dimensional statistic) we display issues according to customfield having several contexts. 
We have for instance a global context which contains 300 values for our select list customfield and a specific context which contains 5 values among the 300.

Generally the values of the select list customfield are displayed in the column header and are hypertextlink (in order to display issues whom custom value equals the value hypertext link). 

But in that case, the value displayed is not an hypertext link (the bug is here).
fields.summary: Problem with customfield having context

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-14013].
  {panel}

USE CASE
often you want to attach stacktraces and other larger text files for tracking purposes that take up way too much space when added as an comment.
it also is mostly the case that you have the text in question in you clip board and not as a distinct file.

what you have to do now, is 
1. create a temp file with the content 
3. get the abs path of the file
2. upload it. 

=> way too many steps in my IMHO

WANTED
a similar function as for screenshots is desirable where you just can copy/past a text and then create the attachment file on the fly.
it would also be very convenient to spec the file type (ie endinf) and the mime type as also (at least i ) atach XML files/snippets often
fields.summary: [attachments] create text attachments on the fly with copy/paste and w/o uploading

fields.description:
If the Trusted Application feature is not working and the following is seen

{noformat}
WARN [atlassian.seraph.filter.TrustedApplicationsFilter] Failed to login trusted application: confluence1234567 due to: 
    com.atlassian.security.auth.trustedapps.InvalidCertificateException: TestTrustedApplicationClient.id 
    cause: java.lang.SecurityException: JCE cannot authenticate the provider BC
{noformat}

This may be due to ClassLoader problems. We have seen this on Resin 2.x for example. To diagnose you can \[turn on DEBUG logging|link\] for the _com.atlassian.seraph_ package to see the stack trace in the log. If the following is shown:

{noformat}
Caused by: java.lang.SecurityException: JCE cannot authenticate the provider BC
	at javax.crypto.Cipher.getInstance(DashoA12275)
	at javax.crypto.Cipher.getInstance(DashoA12275)
	at com.atlassian.security.auth.trustedapps.BouncyCastleEncryptionProvider.decodeEncryptedCertificate(BouncyCastleEncryptionProvider.java:123)
	... 29 more
Caused by: java.util.jar.JarException: Class is on the bootclasspath
	at javax.crypto.SunJCE_d.a(DashoA12275)
	at javax.crypto.SunJCE_b.b(DashoA12275)
	at javax.crypto.SunJCE_b.a(DashoA12275)
	... 32 more
{noformat}

and the bcprov jar is definitely _not_ on the boot class path, the problem is caused by an errant ClassLoader that defines the class without providing a valid [ProtectionDomain|http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.4.2/docs/api/java/security/ProtectionDomain.html] object. Essentially, security provider classes *must* be loaded using the correct [ClassLoader method|http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.4.2/docs/api/java/lang/ClassLoader.html#defineClass(java.lang.String,%20byte[],%20int,%20int,%20java.security.ProtectionDomain)].

The solution is to add the Bouncy Castle security provider jar to the application server classpath. For Resin this means to add {{bcprov-jdk14-138.jar}} to the {{server/lib}} directory.
fields.summary: Authenticating security providers fails due to ClassLoader bugs
Create a Jelly tag for modifying an existing custom field, particularly the available values (options)

fields.description: There is a bug which causes the database to be in an inconsistent state after deleting custom fields. There should be additional checks in the Integrity Checker to identify these particular inconsistencies. Specifically, when deleting a Custom Field, any associated FieldConfiguration rows which contained that Custom Field in the FieldId column are not deleted. This causes problems when trying to retrieve those FieldConfigurations later, as the Field they refer to no longer exists.
fields.summary: Integrity Checker should be updated to check for deleted custom fields in FieldConfiguration

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce the bug:
# Create a new Issue Type ({{Defunct Issue Type}})
# Create a new Custom Field ({{Bad Custom Field}}) and configure it to be enabled for {{Defunct Issue Type}}
# Delete {{Bad Custom Field}}
# Attempt to delete {{Defunct Issue Type}} - a 500 error page is displayed with a {{NullPointerException}}. Stack trace looks something like this:

{noformat}
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.config.persistence.FieldConfigPersisterImpl.getFieldConfig(FieldConfigPersisterImpl.java:118)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.config.persistence.FieldConfigSchemePersisterImpl.transformToDomainObject(FieldConfigSchemePersisterImpl.java:248)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.config.persistence.FieldConfigSchemePersisterImpl.getFieldConfigScheme(FieldConfigSchemePersisterImpl.java:176)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.config.persistence.CachedFieldConfigSchemePersister.getFieldConfigScheme(CachedFieldConfigSchemePersister.java:54)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.config.persistence.FieldConfigSchemePersisterImpl.getInvalidFieldConfigSchemeAfterIssueTypeRemoval(FieldConfigSchemePersisterImpl.java:113)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.config.manager.FieldConfigSchemeManagerImpl.getInvalidFieldConfigSchemesForIssueTypeRemoval(FieldConfigSchemeManagerImpl.java:289)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.config.manager.FieldConfigSchemeManagerImpl.removeInvalidFieldConfigSchemesForIssueType(FieldConfigSchemeManagerImpl.java:273)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.issuetypes.DeleteIssueType.doExecute(DeleteIssueType.java:181)
{noformat}
fields.summary: NullPointerException thrown when deleting an Issue Type which was configured for a non-existent Custom Field

fields.description:
It's nearly impossible to work with the Full Configure Dashboard when you have multiple items of the same portlet type.  

I need to use about 5 or 6 different "Two-Dimensional Filter Statistics" reports in my dashboard, and all the configure UI says is "Two-Dimensional Filter Statistics" for each one.  Not very helpful.  It would be better if:

# the item gave a "hint" of the assigned filter.. like "Two-Dimensional Filter Statistics: *Open in 2.0*"
# there was a "short name" associated with each filter type, so it wouldn't take up so much space in the Configure interface.  Or, just make the boxes a lot wider.  :-)
fields.summary: Configure Dashboard (Full Configure) - Improve item display format

- Configure Dashboard

Looks like designed by different designers.

fields.summary: Unify icons of controls which do the same but look very different

fields.description: If one user creates a filter and shares it to a group a second user is in, the second user can delete that filter.  To do so they must manage their own filters, copy the Delete url from one of their own, and replace the filterid in that url with the one of the shared filter.  Simply pasting in the url with a filterid of a filter they cannot view does not allow them to delete it.
fields.summary: Anyone can delete a filter which is shared with them.

fields.description:
When you are doing a bulk change from the issue navigator, the new german translations uses terms, which are definitly *very* unusual for a native german speaker.

Here are the worst ones für the area of bulk changes.

1. On the last page of a bulk change process you have the options to cancel or to execute the changes. In German the "execute" button is named "Wiederholen", which means "repeat". I would propose changing the text on this button to "Bestätigen" (which means "confirm")

2. When you chose, which action to take for the bulk change you can select "workflow actions", which are translated as "Übergangsvorgänge". This translation is a total "fanatsy-word", with no meaning. As the term "Workflow" is now translated as "Arbeitsablauf" in JIRA the translationen "Arbeitsablauf-Aktionen" would be much better as it would be at least consistent with the translation of "Workflow"

3. On the Issue-Navigator the word "bulk change" is translated as "Mehrfaches Ändern", which means "Multiple Changes", which is not really wrong, but also not a very good translation. Better would be "Massenbearbeitung".

Would be great if you would change it in the next minor release.

Just as a warning :-) I have just released JIRA 3.10.2 to the rest of our company and i expect a lot more translation-change-requests coming your way the next weeks.
fields.summary: New german translation is "buggy" concerning Bulkchange

fields.description:
Hi,
One of our users came to me with following problem: He doesnt loggin while using Jira. Instead he look up issues as an anyomous-user. He was searching for some issues via "Filter: Edit". After that he clicked on "Manage". Under Operations he found the "Save"-Operation and used it, which produce a Tomcat-Exception.. 

I was able to reproduce this error:
I logged out,
I clicked on "Find Issue", "Edit","View","Manange" and the "save"-Option didnt appear.
Now I switch several time between "Manage","Edit","View" and suddenly die Save-Option appears.

I found this feature on our  3.7 and 3.11 System.
I attached a screen-shot.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
typeException report
message
descriptionThe server encountered an internal error () that prevented it from fulfilling this request.
exceptionjavax.servlet.ServletException: java.lang.NullPointerException com.atlassian.jira.web.dispatcher.JiraServletDispatcher.service(JiraServletDispatcher.java:232) javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:803) com.atlassian.jira.web.filters.AccessLogFilter.doFilter(AccessLogFilter.java:51) com.opensymphony.module.sitemesh.filter.PageFilter.parsePage(PageFilter.java:119) com.opensymphony.module.sitemesh.filter.PageFilter.doFilter(PageFilter.java:55) com.atlassian.jira.web.filters.SitemeshExcludePathFilter.doFilter(SitemeshExcludePathFilter.java:38) com.atlassian.seraph.filter.SecurityFilter.doFilter(SecurityFilter.java:182) com.atlassian.seraph.filter.LoginFilter.doFilter(LoginFilter.java:181) com.atlassian.util.profiling.filters.ProfilingFilter.doFilter(ProfilingFilter.java:132) com.atlassian.jira.web.filters.JIRAProfilingFilter.doFilter(JIRAProfilingFilter.java:16) com.atlassian.jira.web.filters.ActionCleanupDelayFilter.doFilter(ActionCleanupDelayFilter.java:41) com.atlassian.jira.web.filters.RequestCleanupFilter.doFilter(RequestCleanupFilter.java:49) com.atlassian.johnson.filters.JohnsonFilter.doFilter(JohnsonFilter.java:91) com.atlassian.jira.web.filters.gzip.GzipFilter.doFilter(GzipFilter.java:72) com.atlassian.core.filters.AbstractEncodingFilter.doFilter(AbstractEncodingFilter.java:37) com.atlassian.jira.appconsistency.db.DatabaseCompatibilityEnforcerFilter.doFilter(DatabaseCompatibilityEnforcerFilter.java:25)

root causejava.lang.NullPointerException com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.SearchRequestManagerImpl.getRequest(SearchRequestManagerImpl.java:186) com.atlassian.jira.web.action.filter.SaveAsFilter.doValidation(SaveAsFilter.java:53) webwork.action.ActionSupport.validate(ActionSupport.java:373) webwork.action.ActionSupport.execute(ActionSupport.java:150) com.atlassian.jira.action.JiraActionSupport.execute(JiraActionSupport.java:54) webwork.dispatcher.GenericDispatcher.executeAction(GenericDispatcher.java:132) com.atlassian.jira.web.dispatcher.JiraServletDispatcher.service(JiraServletDispatcher.java:209) javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:803) com.atlassian.jira.web.filters.AccessLogFilter.doFilter(AccessLogFilter.java:51) com.opensymphony.module.sitemesh.filter.PageFilter.parsePage(PageFilter.java:119) com.opensymphony.module.sitemesh.filter.PageFilter.doFilter(PageFilter.java:55) com.atlassian.jira.web.filters.SitemeshExcludePathFilter.doFilter(SitemeshExcludePathFilter.java:38) com.atlassian.seraph.filter.SecurityFilter.doFilter(SecurityFilter.java:182) com.atlassian.seraph.filter.LoginFilter.doFilter(LoginFilter.java:181) com.atlassian.util.profiling.filters.ProfilingFilter.doFilter(ProfilingFilter.java:132) com.atlassian.jira.web.filters.JIRAProfilingFilter.doFilter(JIRAProfilingFilter.java:16) com.atlassian.jira.web.filters.ActionCleanupDelayFilter.doFilter(ActionCleanupDelayFilter.java:41) com.atlassian.jira.web.filters.RequestCleanupFilter.doFilter(RequestCleanupFilter.java:49) com.atlassian.johnson.filters.JohnsonFilter.doFilter(JohnsonFilter.java:91) com.atlassian.jira.web.filters.gzip.GzipFilter.doFilter(GzipFilter.java:72) com.atlassian.core.filters.AbstractEncodingFilter.doFilter(AbstractEncodingFilter.java:37) com.atlassian.jira.appconsistency.db.DatabaseCompatibilityEnforcerFilter.doFilter(DatabaseCompatibilityEnforcerFilter.java:25)

fields.description:
If the *notifyusers* handler parameter is explicitely set to true as "notifyusers=true" then it is discarded and notification emails are not sent to users.
I believe the reason is how the value of this parameter is converted to a boolean value: using {{Boolean.getBoolean()}} instead of {{Boolean.valueOf()}}

Other cases work fine:

If it is not specified, emails are sent (as default behaviour).
If set to false, emails are not sent.
fields.summary: "notifyusers=true" handler parameter is not interpreted correctly

fields.description:
*JIRA Popups still using english formats* (see screenshot)

i would summarize it like this:

# have a language setting for the JIRA installation (default english)
# make your personal profile another language
# the popup which appears for the calendar is still in english, that means its returning the english format
# the validation is on the main page (e.g. german profile setting)

I would guess that the popup is not translated and it is even hardcoded that it takes the english format or it takes the general configuration, like you said. As you can see on the screenshot it says today, which is not german like the rest of the browser.
fields.summary: JIRA date-problems in international environments

fields.description: The first step in the guides for any user running an importer such as the CSV importer at http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.11/csv_import.html should be to create a backup. Otherwise, they may lose data, for example by unintentionally overwriting existing issues.
fields.summary: Document that users importing from other systems such as via CSV should backup their data first

fields.description:
Currently, if _anyone_ is notified (via the notification scheme) of the "Issue Assigned" event, then the current assignee gets a notification email too.  For example, say I my notification contains just:

| Issue Assigned  (System)  |  Single User (fred) (Delete) | Add |

Then both fred _and the current assignee_ will get notified if someone changes the assignee. This seems wrong - the assignee should only get an email if "Current Assignee" is to be notified of the event.
fields.summary: Existing assignee notified of reassignments even when "Current Assignee" not selected

fields.description:
Way to reproduce:

1) Deploy 3.11
2) Use Turkey Language pack
3) Create a new issue
4) Click on the due date (calendar popup is not working)
fields.summary: Calendar popup is not working if you are using Turkey language pack

fields.description:
Hi guys,

I found a minor bug in the French and German language pack. It will cause a bug as you can see from the screenshot.

The 'culprit' is the '\' at the end of another key (admin.setpassword.success.title):

JiraWebActionSupport_de_DE.properties
{noformat}
...
#setpasswordsuccess.jsp
admin.setpassword.success.title=Neues Passwort wurde erfolgreich festgelegt f\u00fcr: {0}\
admin.setpassword.success.desc=Passwort f\u00fcr Benutzer {0} wurde erfolgreich festgelegt
...
{noformat}

JiraWebActionSupport_fr_FR.properties
{noformat}
...
#setpasswordsuccess.jsp
admin.setpassword.success.title=Nouveau mot de passe d\u00e9fini avec succ\u00e8s pour : {0}\
admin.setpassword.success.desc=Le mot de passe de l''utilisateur {0} a \u00e9t\u00e9 d\u00e9fini avec succ\u00e8s
...
{noformat}
fields.summary: Translation for French and German breaks in the change password screen

fields.description:
It seems that when doing a Bulk Move and moving an issue to a new Project (with a different issue security level scheme), you cannot choose the new security level.
It will always just go to the default of the new project.
This needs more investigation, as maybe I don't have the permissions set up correctly?
fields.summary: Bulk Move should let you choose a new Security Level when moving an issue to a new project

SOAP call to modify user attributes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-13984].
  {panel}

User requested the following:

> within the group browser I can see, in which permission scheme a group is involved. If I delete a group, there is no warning that this group is used in a 
> permission scheme, the group will be removed and the group is automatically removed in the permission scheme(s), too. So far, ok, because the involved > permission schemes are listed.
> But if I want to delete a group, I need not only to know in which permission scheme this group is involved, but also in which
> 
>     * project (as a projectrole)
>     * issue security scheme
>     * notification scheme
>     * workflow (as a condition).
>  I have tried to delete a group, which is used in the above cases and the group was simply removed and every usage of this group was simply removed, 
> too without warning. And this behaviour is dangerous for our application.

>  So my question is, how can I find out all sites where a group is used, before deleting this group?
fields.summary: Add a warning and show all the associated schemes before deleting group from JIRA.

fields.description:
HTML notification emails do not reflect the color and style / look and feel configured from within the JIRA webapp
issue links are specifically not carried over. 
This has been verified with JIRA 3.9.2
fields.summary: html notifications do not reflect the color/style sheet configured under look and feel in JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-13981].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 29 October 2012|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi All,

Good news! We have addressed the original improvement request provided in the description of this issue, in JIRA 5.2. Users now have the ability to edit a workflow scheme on a project - a draft is created, and the migration is handled through the normal migration process. Functionality that has been provided:
* Add existing workflows
* Remove workflows from scheme
* Reassign issue types between workflows in the scheme
* Publish draft
* Discard draft

You can read all about the new improvements in the latest [JIRA EAP release notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+5.2+EAP+4+(m6)+Release+Notes].

This functionality works if you have a 1:1 mapping between a project and a workflow scheme. I understand that this does not fulfil the functionality discussed in [JRA-5254], which is also mentioned in the comments on this issue. *We understand this and are actively addressing* [JRA-5254] - unfortunately it is not a part of JIRA 5.2.

Going forward, I will be resolving this issue when JIRA 5.2 is released in the coming weeks, and leaving [JRA-5254] open until that is fully addressed and workflow schemes can be edited when they are associated with more than one project.

If you have any questions or concerns feel free to contact me directly.

Thanks for your understanding,
Josh Devenny
JIRA Product Management
jdevenny at atlassian dot com
{panel}



Original Description
--------------------

So the current process is:
  1) Create a workflow with all steps etc
  2) Create workflow scheme, assigning issue types to workflows
  3) Configure project to use the new workflow
  4) Realise that you've forgotton something
  5) swear
  6) Copy Workflow - making required changes
  7) Copy workflow scheme
  8) Delete all assigned workflows in copied scheme
  9) Assign issue types to new workflows
  10) Configure project to use new workflow

.. And then there's the clean up stage where you delete the previous workflow scheme and workflow.

I've rarely seen changes to the workflow scheme once it's been configured, so it's just extra work to reconfigure the scheme for the new adjusted workflow.
fields.summary: Allow to edit an active workflow scheme

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-13980].
  {panel}

When using external authentication, it's possible to get into a state where multiple user entries exist for the same account.  This causes some difficult to diagnose problems, and leads to risky repairs.  Here's an example of a recent problem, for which it appears there are even explicit exceptions being raised in the code:

2007-11-16 02:36:34,885 http-123.123.123.123-443-Processor2 ERROR [web.action.issue.ViewIssue] Exception getting actions Found more than
one user with name 'Foo Bar'; ids
[GenericEntity:OSUser][passwordHash,blahblahblah][name,Foo Bar][id,12345], [GenericEntity:OSUser][passwordHash,null][name,Foo Bar][id,12346]

It would be extremely handy to have an integrity checker for the user table that would find potential duplicate user entries (and even better if it had a repair mode).
fields.summary: Integrity checker for user table

fields.description:
Links panel does not show type of linked issue - is it bug or new feature or task...
I have to click linked issues to see what is it.

Having added one more indicator *Issue Type* would save me from these clicks.
See screenshot where I propose to add indicator.
fields.summary: Issue type indicator next to Priority and Status indicators on the Links Panel

fields.description:
The documentation for AddPermission: AttachmentDeleteAll and AttachmentDeleteOwn should be AttachDeleteAll  and AttachDeleteOwn.
I have not verified the other new permissions
fields.summary: Correct Jelly Tags documentation for new permissions in AddPermission

fields.description:
Linktype "Cloners" may but must not be renamed.
If it will be renamed cloning an issue will result in an error.

h3. Workaround
See [The Clone Link Type 'Cloners' Does Not Exist Due to Missing Property|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/The+Clone+Link+Type+%27Cloners%27+Does+Not+Exist+Due+to+Missing+Property].
fields.summary: Allow to rename link "Cloners" without having to modify jira-application.properties

fields.description:
Hi Rosie and Andrew,

I have just added some content to the Logging and Profiling page of the JIRA documentation, on how to make Profiling permanent (i.e. still enabled after restarting JIRA). I committed it to the trunk as revision 48955.

It was a moderately substantial addition, so could one of you please review it and clean it up if necessary. I'm confident that it is technically correct, but it might need some technical writer love and care.

Thanks.

Kind regards,
Ian
fields.summary: Review changes to Profiling documentation - new content on making Profiling permanent

fields.description: as per Jeff's suggestions: http://extranet.atlassian.com/display/~jmcmillan/First+Impressions+of+JIRA+Evaluation+Install
fields.summary: improve the Installation documentation

fields.description:
According to Alexander Weber from Map Solute:

I found a solution how to detect if SP2 for IE 6 is installed and though maybe that is usefull to you too. It can be detected within the user-agent, refer:

http://msdn2.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms537503.aspx#UARegistry

''For example, an "SV1" token appears in the user-agent string of a Microsoft Windows XP user who has installed Windows XP Service Pack 2 (SP2).''

Therefore you might check the user-agent for the tag "SV1" to detect service pack 2 beeing installed.

We had the same problem to solve and one important customer had IE 6.0 SP1 installed, but we didn't want to disable compression at all for SP2 users, which are the majority I guess (because compression works fine for those users).
fields.summary: Investigate whether to expand gzip filter to include IE6 SP2

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-13960].
  {panel}

when viewing the sub tasks list of a specific issue
we need the ability to export those sub tasks to an excel file
the data in the excel file should be the same as when i export issues from the "find issues" menu,
this means that the output should be detailed and not only a representation of what we see on the screen.

a screenshot with an example sub tasks list is hereby attached
fields.summary: adding the ability to export sub tasks to an excel file

fields.description:
Sometimes we request that a support customer turn profiling on, but when we eventually get the logs there is no profiling information in them. It turns out that the customer has restarted the server. It would be nice to have some way to turn profiling on so that it survives a server restart.

I started looking through the source, and based on com.atlassian.util.profiling.UtilTimerStack, it seemed to me that the way to do it was to add a "-Datlassian.profile.activate=true" entry to JAVA_OPTS in bin/setenv.sh. 

However when I do this and restart the server, profiling is briefly on, then something turns it off:
{noformat}
[16ms] - ProjectCache.refresh

2007-11-13 17:51:11,733 main INFO [atlassian.jira.upgrade.ConsistencyCheckImpl] Starting JIRA Enterprise Edition, Version: 3.11-#288
2007-11-13 17:51:11,734 main INFO [atlassian.jira.upgrade.ConsistencyCheckImpl] Configured to use database: mysql
[2ms] - IssueIndexManager.getAllIndexPaths()

[1ms] - Collection.iterator()

[0ms] - Iterator.hasNext()

[0ms] - Iterator.next()

[0ms] - Iterator.hasNext()

[0ms] - Iterator.next()

[0ms] - Iterator.hasNext()

2007-11-13 17:51:11,795 main INFO [atlassian.jira.upgrade.ConsistencyCheckImpl] 

****************************************************************************************************
JIRA 3.11 build: 288 (Enterprise Edition) started. You can now access JIRA through your web browser.
****************************************************************************************************

[Filter: profiling] Using parameter [jira_profile]
[Filter: profiling] defaulting to off [autostart=false]
[Filter: profiling] Turning filter off [jira_profile=off]
{noformat}

And when I started reading com.atlassian.util.profiling.filters.ProfilingFilter (in atlassian-profiling), it seems that there is another parameter that we specify in our web.xml:
{code}
    <filter>
        <filter-name>profiling</filter-name>
        <filter-class>com.atlassian.jira.web.filters.JIRAProfilingFilter</filter-class>
        <init-param>
            <!-- specify the which HTTP parameter to use to turn the filter on or off -->
            <!-- if not specified - defaults to "profile.filter" -->
            <param-name>activate.param</param-name>
            <param-value>jira_profile</param-value>
        </init-param>
        <init-param>
            <!-- specify the whether to start the filter automatically -->
            <!-- if not specified - defaults to "true" -->
            <param-name>autostart</param-name>
            <param-value>false</param-value>
        </init-param>
    </filter>
{code}

I'm confused. If there is an existing way of making profiling persistent that my puny brain can't work out, please let me know what it is.

If not, can we have such a way please?
fields.summary: Provide a means of making profiling persistent - i.e. still turned on after a server restart

fields.description:
Reindex in Lucene is a performance bottleneck.

When we move a subtask to a new parent it re-indexes the subtask 3 times in the one operation:
1) When we remove the link to the old parent
2) When we create the link to the new parrent.
3) When we update the issue for the (possibly changed) security level.
fields.summary: Moving a subtask to a new Parent calls too many re-indexes on Lucene.
